tasks.title: Project Setup and Cargo Initialization
tasks.description: Initialize a new Rust project using Cargo, configure `Cargo.toml` with project metadata, and add the `clap` dependency for argument parsing.
tasks.notes:
A new Rust project directory is created.
`Cargo.toml` is correctly configured.
`clap` is added as a dependency.

tasks.title: Implement Core 'Hello, World!' Functionality
tasks.description: Develop the basic functionality to print 'Hello, World!' to standard output when the CLI is executed without any arguments, and ensure a zero exit status.
tasks.notes:
WHEN the user executes `hello-world` without arguments, THEN 'Hello, World!' is printed.
THEN the system exits with a zero status code.

tasks.title: Define CLI Structure with Clap
tasks.description: Create `src/cli.rs` to define the CLI application's structure using `clap` traits and attributes. This includes defining the main application and its version.
tasks.notes:
`src/cli.rs` is created and contains a `clap` `Struct` or `Enum` defining the CLI.
The application version is configured in `clap`.

tasks.title: Implement Help and Version Display
tasks.description: Integrate `clap`'s automatic help and version generation into `main.rs`. Ensure that `--help`, `-h`, `--version`, and `-V` flags correctly display the respective information and exit with a zero status.
tasks.notes:
WHEN `hello-world --help` or `hello-world -h` is executed, THEN a help message is displayed.
WHEN `hello-world --version` or `hello-world -V` is executed, THEN the application version is displayed.
All help/version commands exit with a zero status code.

tasks.title: Implement Invalid Argument Handling
tasks.description: Configure `clap` to automatically handle unknown or invalid arguments. Ensure that an appropriate error message is printed to standard error and the application exits with a non-zero status code when an invalid argument is provided.
tasks.notes:
WHEN `hello-world --foo` (or any unknown argument) is executed, THEN an error message is printed to stderr.
THEN the system exits with a non-zero status code.

tasks.title: Create Message Handler Component and Refactor Output
tasks.description: Create a new module `src/message_handler.rs` to encapsulate all message printing logic. Refactor `main.rs` to use functions from this module for printing 'Hello, World!', help, version, and error messages, improving modularity.
tasks.notes:
`src/message_handler.rs` is created with dedicated functions for different message types.
`main.rs` is updated to call functions from `message_handler` for all output.
Application behavior remains unchanged.

tasks.title: Write Unit and Integration Tests
tasks.description: Develop comprehensive unit and integration tests to verify the core 'Hello, World!' functionality, correct help/version output, and robust error handling for invalid arguments. Use `cargo test` for execution.
tasks.notes:
Tests exist for default 'Hello, World!' output.
Tests verify correct output for `--help` and `--version`.
Tests confirm error messages and non-zero exit for invalid arguments.
All tests pass successfully.
